text:
<!channel> I’m pleased to announce the launch of HubSopt’s new official COS Design forum as part of the recently launched HubSpot Community: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/COS-Design/ct-p/designers>

This community has been designed for YOU the HubSpot customer to ask questions, find answers and engage with professionals from all around the world who are driving inbound success with HubSpot’s tools. We welcome all customers, HubSpot Partners and employees to share your expertise and collaborate on best practice use of the HubSpot platform.

Check out our first post from a HubSpot designer looking for redesign feedback on the  ‘Share Your Work’ board: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Share-Your-Work/Redesigned-About-Page-Team-Member-Videos/m-p/122>

*PLEASE NOTE*: This community is still in beta as we work to develop the community for our customers before launch at INBOUND, so all Designer Day attendees have been issued an early invite - enjoy :slightly_smiling_face:

Not sure if this helps to push this ticket along by posting here…anways I’ve found out recently HubL will not render minified stylesheets locally, but comes through with flying colors in production <https://app.HubSpot.com/support/508496/ticket/401871>

Also off-topic from above I’ve found custom modules for HubL to be a bit tedious to work with since we have to use json files to render the custom module locally. This means developers so far have to minify the markup used for the custom module and place in the source key of the json. This is a bit difficult for a workflow when markup/class names have to be adjusted for the custom module and tested locally.
Seems pretty cool that you are rendering it locally....
For a system that isn't designed to be rendered locally
not sure what u mean by that
You are rendering these pages on your local machine?
with custom modules?
are you familiar with HubL?
yeah
ok so whats your question again?
"since we have to use json files to render the custom module locally. "
we are using json to display custom modules is my point
on your local machine?
which is great cause it gets us part way there
yes HubL is local server
understood
<@U2TGY6ECR> pinned a message to this channel.
ok so not sure what your concern or comment relates to here
are you asking how I do this?
You mean to say Hubl Server
hubl is a markup language
HubL <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/intro-to-hubl>
that is where the confusion comes from
ok does that clarify for you now?
my point is custom modules as json is a great start but having to minify the markup anytime it changes on the HubSpot side (not local) is a pain in the butt
or vice versa
<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-hubl-server>
yeha I know what you mean
ok above it did not sound like it
as we were discussing you seemed to have some confusion
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/general/p1477338827000325>
You were saying hubl, not hubl server. that is what caused my confusion
<@U25PYL3Q8> ok so now that we are on the same page would you agree with my concerns?
json is great to have for local development but it still is not ideal for the markup side
I would have to look into it more. I haven't used the local hubl server since just after it came out.

I would have to take a look at what you are doing. I had never done a custom module.. I don't think it had the ability to do anything with custom modules so I just scrapped it, trying to do custom modules in teh editor and doing work locally
So, it sounds like you are replacing the {{ }} with json
<@U2TGY6ECR|dennisgaebel> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/dennisgaebel/F2THDCD5X/custom-module_json.js|custom-module.json>
the `source` key is what I’m referring to
the markup there is what your custom module is on HubSpot
u can still use the same call for a module as well locally
<@U2TGY6ECR|dennisgaebel> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/dennisgaebel/F2THF2YFK/campus_html.html|campus.html>
<@U2TGY6ECR> I couldn't get to your gitlab repo. Where is the compressed css you're referencing?
